TEI.2.document_title: R R Royall to Stephen F Austin, 10-13-1835

barker_notes.barker_summary: Munitions on the road traveling fifteen miles a day
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 178

div1.p: Munitions on the road traveling fifteen miles a day
To the comdt. at head quarters

Judge Smith and Jno A. Wharton have just arrived from Columbia and Inform us of the arrival of 70 musketts seven peices field Canon Powder Lead etc four wagons will leave tomorrow (under the Command of a suitable man) for Columbia for them. You may calculate at 15 miles travel pr day how soon you may Expect them. Mr Wharton thinks one or two Wagons will leave Columbia tomorrow with the arms etc for head Quarters
